intro: Triumfetta reflexa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or small-leaved triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. Triumfetta reflexa is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some areas.
